At a dinner this week, attended by`` The Daily Telegraph'', with conservatives in New York, Donald Rumsfeld elicited murmurs of approval when he suggested that Barack Obama 's troop-heavy strategy in Afghanistan was flawed. I personally did not think we needed to make a Korea out of Afghanistan, he said.`` The Soviets were in there with hundreds of thousands of troops for 12 years and lost. It's a landlocked country, it went through occupation, civil war, drought, hostile neighbours.

Alexandra Marzec, representing Glenn Mulcaire , said there was no clear evidence that her client had intercepted Steve Coogan or Gray's messages. Mr Steve Coogan has not yet gone to the trouble of making an application to the Metropolitan police to see what documentary evidence there is, she said. She said none of the evidence showed there was any interception.
